Package controller

Class AddProduct

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.AddProduct
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AddProduct
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class controls the application window for the AddProduct screen.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        The initialize method sets up the AddProduct screen on launch.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • onAddProductAddButton

        public void onAddProductAddButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onAddProductAddButton is called when the user clicks the add button on the AddProduct screen. This method adds the selected part to the addProductAssocPartsTable.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the AddProduct screen

      • onAddProductRemoveButton

        public void onAddProductRemoveButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onAddProductRemoveButton is called when the user clicks the remove associated parts button on the AddProduct screen. This method removes the selected part from the addProductAssocPartsTable.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the AddProduct screen

      • onAddProductSaveButton

        public void onAddProductSaveButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onAddProductSaveButton method is called when the user clicks the Save button on the AddProduct screen. This method gets the user text inputs and the associated parts list and creates an instance of the Product class. It adds that instance to the allProducts list in the Inventory class. Alerts are in place to catch errors.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the AddPart screen

      • onAddProductCancelButton

        public void onAddProductCancelButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        The onAddProductCancelButton method is called when the user clicks the Cancel button on the AddProduct screen. This method ensures the user wants to cancel, then launches the MainScreen screen of the application.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the AddProduct screen
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onAddProductSearchText

        public void onAddProductSearchText​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onAddProductSearchText is called when the user presses enter while the cursor is in the search window on the AddProduct screen. This method calls the lookupPart method from Inventory and searches for the part based on the user input. Then it places the parts in the tableview.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the enter press on the user keyboard

      • getProductID

        private int getProductID()
        The getProductID method sets a unique ID for the new product. This method checks the allProducts list from Inventory and sets a unique ID to be used for the new product.
        Returns:
        the unique product ID
